sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Find the Hamiltonian cycle in the graph shown below:

![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/uGcSUYe.png)

The vertices are labeled from 1 to 7.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a cycle in a graph that visits each vertex exactly once before returning to the starting vertex. In the given graph, we can find a Hamiltonian cycle as follows:

1 → 2 → 3 → 4 → 5 → 6 → 7 → 1

This cycle visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex 1.
